content: The question has been asked many times and the answer has always avoided attention. How much wood could a woodchuck chuck if a woodchuck could chuck wood? The answer till this point has never been revealed. I spoke with the woodchuck guild and they said they were prepared to release the figure since technology has made this information null and void for any competition to use it to their benefit. The beaver guild is furious because they being the curmudgeons they are won't embrace the technology and make their lives a little easier. They claim that the release of this information could harm their production quotas. Using a little math, any new competition who came into woods would be able to use those figures, to create their own guild or union. Sorry Beavers but here it is. How much wood could a woodchuck chuck if a woodchuck could chuck wood? It has been analyzed and the answer is: Average amount of wood a woodchuck would chuck in a given day 948 butt cords of wood. Median amount of wood a woodchuck could chuck in a given hour 9 butt cords of wood. Record one day high for woodchuck wood chucking of 2679 butt cords was attained on 6/15/1996 . Now you know... Quantum materiae materietur marmota monax si marmota monax materiam possit materiari?

title: How much Wood?

content: Quote SG: "How much wood could a woodchuck chuck if a woodchuck could chuck wood?" Damn, Sarge, I hate to be a wet blanket but the wording I learned was "how much wood would a woodchuck chuck...?". Now if mine is the correct expression then all that scientific stuff you presented is out the window cause how much wood a woodchuck would chuck depends on a whole host of varaibles like how old/big is the chuck in question? male or female (maybe pregnant or caring for young which could affect capabilities)? what kind of wood? (now, I've chewed some wood and know that some is way tougher than others), what season?, etc, ad nauseum. So, while I admire your diligence in researching the issue of how much wood a woodchuck could chuck and appreciate the input from the beaver guild, I have zero confidence in your/their final findings when applied to my version of the little ditty. (WTH is a butt cord anyway??) Surely a good beaver has more endearing and varifiable qualities than how much wood one can handle...then again, maybe not.

content: You guy's are too much. Wood ewe noe if a would charles chucked the would. I donno bout a butt cord, if'n yall sez it's a standard cord, I'll take yer word fer it. The one thing is, A cord of wood when properly stacked should be 4 feet high, 4 feet wide and 8 feet long. Newcomers buy fire wood from guys sitting in their pickemup trucks sitting in a parking lot. The guy in the truck assures them it's a full cord, the wood is barely above the sides of the bed. They soak the gullible $175. and up! Keep smiling, everyone will wonder what you've been up to!
